Detailed Description

Simulation pipe server.

This class creates and manages an asynchronous named pipe for serving simulation information to a MACSim client. Information is obtained by calling the MACSimServerInterface specified at construct time.

Definition at line 136 of file macsim.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SimServer::SimServer (  MACSimServerInterface *  p_interface  )  [inline]
 

Constructor, initialises Server parent as a simulation pipe.

Stores the interface pointer in member variable m_interface and configures the Server as a simulation pipe handler. Numbers of inputs and outputs are obtained from the specified MACSimServerInterface.

  • The server name is set to "simulation"
  • The pipe name is set to MAC_SIM_PIPE_NAME
  • input buffer size is set to sizeof(double) times the number of inputs.
  • output buffer size is set to sizeof(double) times the number of outputs.
Parameters:
p_interface The interface to use for obtaining simulation information.

Definition at line 177 of file macsim.h.

Member Function Documentation

void SimServer::serverFunc (  void *  request,
void *  reply
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Server function, responds to simulation requests

Receives a buffer of length sizeof(double) multiplied by the number of inputs specified by a call to the m_interface member function MACSimServerInterface::getNumInputs(). The m_interface member function MACSimServerInterface::getSimOutputs() is called to determine output information which is returned in the reply buffer. The reply buffer has length sizeof(double) multiplied by the number of outputs specified by a call to the m_interface member function MACSimServerInterface::getNumOutputs().

Parameters:
request A pointer to the request buffer, this will be sizeof(double) times the number of inputs bytes long
reply A pointer to the reply buffer, this will be sizeof(double) times the number of outputs bytes long

Reimplemented from Server.
